newsitem.title: USA: COMEX copper called to open unchanged.
newsitem.headline: COMEX copper called to open unchanged.

text.p: COMEX copper futures were called to open unchanged Friday as the backwardation in London appeared to evaporate amid ample supplies worldwide, dealers said.
COMEX September closed at 103.80 cents a lb Thursday, and traded from 103.80 to 104.10 cents on ACCESS.
The LME three-month price was holding at $2261/2, off from Thursday's close of $2,271 a tonne.

LME warehouse copper stocks jumped another 4,575 tonnes in Friday's report to 260,875 tonnes, with Europe and the U.S. accounting for the increase. Stocks now stand at theire highest level since Sept 19, 1996.
COMEX copper stocks increased another 518 short tons Wednseday to 36,581 short tons.
The LME cash-to-three month backwardation has narrowed to $2/4 a tonne, the narrowest level since October 1996, at which point the copper prices was around 90 cents a pound.

Metal continues to flow into LME warehouses in Europe reflecting the summer shutdowns in that part of the world. In the U.S., over 3,000 tonnes have arrived in exchange warehouses in Baltimore in the last three trading days.
In other news, ZCCM ended labor tensions Friday offering miners a 15 percent wage increase. The mines account for approximately 365,000 tonnes of annual capacity.
